intro: Ternstroemia japonica var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved Japanese ternstroemia, is a flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrub form with elliptical, dark green leaves that are smaller than those of the typical species. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange-red berries. It is native to southern Japan and thrives in shaded, moist woodland environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture for its elegant foliage and seasonal blooms.
